awd_titl_txt: RIA: Research on Partitioning for High Speed and High       Density Circuit Design
awd_abstract_narration: This research is on performance driven partitioning for high speed and          high density circuit design.  Tools for an automatic partitioning system        which divides circuits from the system level to basic layout modules are        being developed.  For systems of several million gates, a technique,            called the ratio cut, is used to define the hierarchy of the system.            The ratio cut is used to identify the cluster structure and thus                organize the system into a tree structure.  A heuristic ratio cut               algorithm is being explored for use in hierarchal partitioning of the           design.  Once a partition has been made there is an optimization                problem.  Solutions to this problem are being investigated using neural         nets, partitioning on special graphs and other methods.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
